meanings.definition: A piece of material used to mend a hole or tear.
meanings.sent1: I used a patch to fix the hole in my jeans.
meanings.sent2: Mom sewed a patch on my backpack to cover the tear.
meanings.sent3: The patch on my shirt made it look like a cool design.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a patch that healed my broken heart.
meanings.sent5: The colorful patch stood out on the dark fabric.

meanings.definition: A small area of ground covered with specific vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The garden had a patch of bright flowers in one corner.
meanings.sent2: The park had a patch of grass perfect for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The patch of daisies looked like a tiny floral carpet.
meanings.sent4: The patch of clover seemed like a green oasis in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The small patch of sunflowers brightened up the field.

meanings.sent1: His apology was just a patch for the argument.
meanings.sent2: Using tape as a patch for the leak was a quick solution.
meanings.sent3: Their excuse was like a flimsy patch on a big problem.
meanings.sent4: The compromise acted as a patch to mend their differences.
meanings.sent5: The bandage served as a patch until they reached the hospital.

meanings.sent1: The farmer owned a patch of land where he grew vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The kids played soccer on the small patch behind the house.
meanings.sent3: The patch of grass was just big enough for a tiny house.
meanings.sent4: The patch of sand by the shore was perfect for building sandcastles.
meanings.sent5: The small patch of forest was home to many birds and squirrels.

meanings.sent1: There was a patch of sunlight on the floor where the cat napped.
meanings.sent2: The patch of shade under the tree was a welcome relief from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The patch of sky visible through the window was a beautiful blue.
meanings.sent4: The small patch of carpet in the room was soft underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The patch of silence in the noisy city was a rare find.
